title: China Is Getting Much of What It Wants From the U.S., Including Chips
summary: For China, President Trump’s moves to loosen chip controls, soften U.S. rhetoric and stay silent on tensions with Japan amount to a rare string of strategic gains.

title: Historic Shift Underway in China’s Economy as Investment Slump Deepens
summary: Investment in manufacturing, infrastructure and property is expected to fall this year, a remarkable turn for an economy whose growth reshaped the world.

title: Republicans Defy Trump in Indiana, and Hundreds Quarantined in Measles Outbreak
summary: Plus, the Friday news quiz.

title: Indiana Senate Republicans Reject Trump’s Redistricting Effort
summary: Republicans hold an overwhelming majority in the Indiana Senate, but more than a dozen of them defied the president’s wishes, voting against a map aimed at adding Republicans in Congress.

title: Key Takeaways After Indiana Lawmakers Defy Trump’s Redistricting Push
summary: President Trump’s failure to ram through a Republican-friendly House map was a new sign that his iron grip on the party has slipped, and was likely to reverberate nationally.

title: Republicans Undercut Johnson, Circumventing Him to Force Votes
summary: The speaker has repeatedly lost his grip on the House floor thanks to a once rare parliamentary maneuver that G.O.P. members are increasingly using to force action on legislation.

title: U.S. Issues New Sanctions Targeting Maduro’s Family and the Oil Sector
summary: The United States is escalating its pressure campaign on Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro, after seizing an oil tanker off the coast.

title: Troops Involved in Boat Strikes Face a ‘Moral Injury’ Risk, Experts Say
summary: Troops who play a part in deadly missions that they see as wrong or unjustified may suffer deep psychological harm as a result, research has shown.

title: What to Know About Trump’s Seizure of an Oil Tanker Near Venezuela
summary: The tanker was headed eastward and had recently carried Iranian oil. The seizure is an escalation in President Trump’s military pressure campaign against Venezuela’s leader, Nicolás Maduro.

title: Trump Moves to Stop States From Regulating AI With a New Executive Order
summary: The order would create one federal regulatory framework for artificial intelligence, President Trump told reporters in the Oval Office.

title: Kids Rarely Read Whole Books Anymore. Even in English Class.
summary: When teachers do assign whole books, they often choose from a stagnant list of classics.

title: Paramount Says Money Is No Object. Warner Bros. Isn’t Convinced.
summary: Larry Ellison is backstopping Paramount’s bid for Warner Brothers, but Warner Brothers is concerned that the billionaire has not provided a personal guarantee to pay.

title: 100,000 in Washington State Ordered to Evacuate as Rivers Rise
summary: Days of heavy rain pushed waterways to record flood levels in a mountainous region north of Seattle. “Do not wait,” local officials warned residents, urging them to seek higher ground.

title: Harold Hamm, Oklahoma Oil Tycoon, Allies With Trump to Reshape U.S. Energy
summary: Harold Hamm, an Oklahoma oil tycoon, has played a central role in reshaping energy policy by allying himself with President Trump.

title: Mamdani Will Be New York City’s First Soccer-Mad Mayor
summary: Zohran Mamdani isn’t just a superfan. Until recently, he was a key player on the Talking Headers, a rec-league team where he was known as Z.

title: Thailand Says Trump Call About Cambodia Conflict Is Set for Friday
summary: President Trump’s planned intervention comes as the hostilities entered their fifth day and appeared to escalate, and while Thailand moves toward early elections.

title: Review of Medical Cannabis Use Finds Little Evidence of Benefit
summary: Researchers found a chasm between the health reasons for which the public seeks out cannabis and what gold-standard science actually shows about its effectiveness.

title: Our Book Critics on Their Year in Reading
summary: Alexandra Jacobs, Jennifer Szalai and Dwight Garner look back at the books that, as Jacobs writes, “bonked me on the head this year.”

title: Does Paramount’s David Ellison Know What He’s Doing?
summary: David Ellison is cozying up to Trump in his effort to save Hollywood. It’s a risky strategy for our democracy.

title: Why Is It So Hard to Build Big Things?
summary: Today we look at the state of American inertia.

title: Jimmy Kimmel Takes a Swipe at Trump’s ‘Gold Card’
summary: The new visa for rich foreigners had Kimmel rethinking the Statue of Liberty’s inscription: “Never mind your poor and tired. Give us a million bucks — you’re in.”

title: Reddit Sues Australian Government to Block Social Media Ban
summary: The company said the new law, which makes it illegal for children under 16 to have social media accounts, infringes on children’s rights.

title: King Charles to Speak About His Cancer in Televised Message
summary: A video of the king discussing his “recovery journey” will air on Channel 4 on Friday. He was diagnosed with an unspecified type of cancer last year.

title: D.L. Coburn, Playwright With a Solo Hit, ‘The Gin Game,’ Dies at 87
summary: His two-character work won a Pulitzer Prize and had a long Broadway run, but he never replicated its success and struggled to get his later work staged.
